questions.question: Read the following passage and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: 'You are very lazy. Really, considering that I am going to give you my wheel barrow, I think you might work Harder. Idleness is a great sin and I certainly don't like any of my friends to be idle or sluggish. You must not mind my speaking quite plainly to you. Of course, I should not dream of doing so if I were not your friend. But what is the good of friendship if one cannot say exactly what one means? Anybody can say charming things and try to please and to flatter, but a true friend always says unpleasant things and does not mind giving pain.'
